intro: Melilotus segetalis subsp. fallax, commonly known as fallax melilot, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with yellow flowers clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop for livestock.
